name: opencode-plugin-manager
description: Command-line interface for managing OpenCode plugins from the OpenCode Plugin Marketplace. Install marketplace plugins, create new plugin templates, and manage your plugin collection. (Experimental)

installation.summary: Copy the plugin command file to your OpenCode configuration directory.
installation.markdown:
## Installation

> **‚ö†Ô∏è Experimental:** This feature is experimental and may change in future versions.

### Quick Install (Recommended)

**For global installation (available in all projects):**

```bash
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Tommertom/opencode-plugin-marketplace/main/command/plugin.md \
  -o ~/.config/opencode/command/plugin.md
```

**For local installation (current project only):**

```bash
mkdir -p .opencode/command
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Tommertom/opencode-plugin-marketplace/main/command/plugin.md \
  -o .opencode/command/plugin.md
```

### Manual Install

**Clone and copy:**

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/Tommertom/opencode-plugin-marketplace.git

# For global installation
cp -r opencode-plugin-marketplace/command ~/.config/opencode/

# OR for local installation
cp -r opencode-plugin-marketplace/command .opencode/
```

### Verify Installation

Restart OpenCode and run:

```
/plugin
```

You should see the plugin manager usage instructions.

> **Note:** This is a "meta" plugin - it manages other plugins but must be installed manually first. Once installed, you can use `/plugin` to manage all other plugins.

usage.markdown:
## Usage

> **‚ö†Ô∏è Experimental:** This feature is experimental and may change in future versions.

### Available Commands

#### List Plugins
```
/plugin list
```
Displays all available plugins in the marketplace with their installability status.

#### Install a Plugin
```
/plugin install <plugin-name>
```
Installs a plugin from the marketplace to your local `.opencode/` directory.

**Requirements:**
- Plugin must be marked with `installableFromMarketplace: true`
- Automatically clones repositories and copies necessary files
- Updates `opencode.json` if needed

**Example:**
```
/plugin install opencode-context-analysis
```

#### Create a New Plugin
```
/plugin create <plugin-name>
```
Scaffolds a new plugin with boilerplate code. You'll be prompted to choose:
- Tool plugin (TypeScript)
- Command plugin (Markdown)
- Both

**Example:**
```
/plugin create my-awesome-plugin
```

#### Remove a Plugin
```
/plugin remove <plugin-name>
```
Removes an installed plugin (requires confirmation).

**Example:**
```
/plugin remove my-awesome-plugin
```

### Features

- **üîç Discovery**: Browse and search marketplace plugins
- **‚ö° Quick Install**: One-command installation for compatible plugins
- **üõ†Ô∏è Scaffolding**: Generate plugin boilerplate with proper structure
- **üßπ Clean Removal**: Safely remove plugins with confirmation
- **üìù Smart Updates**: Automatically manages `opencode.json` configuration
- **üîí Safe Operations**: Confirmation prompts for destructive actions
- **üìä Verbose Errors**: Detailed error messages for troubleshooting

### Plugin Name Requirements

- Lowercase letters only
- Alphanumeric characters
- Hyphens allowed (no spaces or underscores)
- Example: `my-plugin-123`

### Installation Locations

- **Global**: `~/.config/opencode/` - Available in all projects
- **Local**: `.opencode/` - Only available in current project

The plugin manager defaults to local installation for new plugins.
